alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Central; Baldwin Inland (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 2:29PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Baldwin County through 315 PM CDT... At 228 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Downtown Mobile to 4 miles west of Stapleton to near Bay Minette. Movement was southeast at 5 mph. Another strong thunderstorm was located near Loxley and was drifting west. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Daphne, Fairhope, Bay Minette, Spanish Fort, Robertsdale, Loxley, Stapleton, Silverhill and I65 And AL 225. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
